revised_title: Studies on the Physiology of Batrachian Lymph-Hearts and their Electrical Stimulation
tldr: This article examines the anatomy and physiology of batrachian lymph-hearts, focusing on their independence from the blood-heart and their response to electrical currents. The author confirms previous observations on the structure and function of lymph-hearts and investigates the effects of electrical currents on their rhythm. The study also explores the role of the spinal cord in controlling the lymph-heart's rhythm and the impact of sensory stimuli on their function.
